  • Resources Definitions
  • Token

Tokens

Tokens are the primary way of authenticating with the HTTP API. They are generated by some entity for a specific timeframe and may only be used by an entity who knows the secret key of the token.

Expiration and Usage

Each token carries a usage_time and expires field. These fields dictate the lifetime of a token. For normal tokens any usage of the HTTP API will reset the expires field to NOW * usage_time milliseconds.

Revocation

Once a token is revoked the token will be unusable for any further requests. Some examples of how to revocate are expiration, token revocation or  user logout, or usage (in case of one-time-token). Once revoked the time and reason will be set inrevoked.at and revoked.reason respectively.

  • name – A human readable name for the token
  • type – One of one-time-token, token or session, token or session
  • owner – A reference to the resource owning the token. Takes the form <type>/<resource>
  • key – The key used to sign requests for this token
  • fingerprint – The fingerprint used to uniquly identify this token
  • usage_time – The time, in milliseconds, interval this token is valid
  • expires – The datetime for this token to expire
  • revoked.at – The datetime for when this token was revoked
  • revoked.reason – The reason why this token was revoked
  • meta.created – ISO 8601 datetime of creation
  • meta.updated – Last updates ISO 8601 datetime
